sentences.en: a scurrilous attack on his integrity
sentences.cn: 对他正直人格的恶意诋毁

sentences.en: He felt he would demean himself if he replied to scurrilous letter.
sentences.cn: 他觉得如果他回复那封充满辱骂的信,会自贬身份.

sentences.en: Her scurrilous performances have already condemned her.
sentences.cn: 她的信口漫骂的演出已给她定了罪.

sentences.en: However the Lord went on to warn them that their scurrilous claim was indeed blasphemy.
sentences.cn: 然而,主耶稣还是继续警告他们这样污秽的话是亵渎神的.

sentences.en: I shall not reply to such a scurrilous attack upon me; it is beneath contempt.
sentences.cn: 对我的这咱毁谤性攻击,我将不予以回驳; 那是不值得一顾的.

sentences.en: It is sad that scurrilous rumour made the newspapers and has been presented as fact.
sentences.cn: 令人感到悲哀的是,这样一则粗俗无礼的传闻居然被报纸大肆,并且被写成了所谓的事实.

sentences.en: Satan dropped it there, I take it, intending a scurrilous jest against your reverence.
sentences.cn: 我想, 准是撒旦丢在那儿, 有意中伤阁下您的.

sentences.en: Scurrilous and untrue stories were being invented.
sentences.cn: 有人正在捏造虚假诽谤的故事。

sentences.en: She was frightened by an utterly false accusation and an utterly scurrilous threat.
sentences.cn: 她受到人家彻头彻尾的诬告,还被人家彻头彻尾的卑鄙威胁吓坏了.

sentences.en: She was often quite scurrilous in her references to me.
sentences.cn: 她一提起我,常常骂骂咧咧的.

sentences.en: The hoodlums defiled the church with their scurrilous writing.
sentences.cn: 这群无赖写了许多庸俗下流的东西,玷污了这座教堂.

words.tran_cn: 下流；刻薄嘴；谈吐卑劣粗俗
下流的；说话粗鄙恶劣的；无礼的

trans.tran_cn: 恶语诽谤的，造谣中伤的
trans.tran_en: Scurrilous accusations or stories are untrue and unfair, and are likely to damage the reputation of the person that they relate to
